reviewText: The Musketeers takes more attention than other resource- and time-management games to be able to get through the levels. This could be a positive if you've overplayed all those other games and want a challenge. Or it could be a negative if you want a relaxing game that never lets you paint yourself into a corner.\n\nPersonally, I'm not fond of the art style (especially since it makes it hard to tell where the paths are). But tastes vary, so judge for yourself.
voteText: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
A really charming (and additive!) resource management game. The core loop is simple â€“ You want to get from Point A to Point B and you have a mini-objective along the way. Clear the path to your end goal by gathering resources and clearing obstacles. Obstacles cost resources to clear. Spend resources to build buildings that give you more resources.

The game gradually introduces more mechanics as you go (crafting, inventory items you can equip for bonuses, boosts, etc)
The levels and objectives are varied, the story is simple but sweet, and the music and sound FX are enjoyable.

10/10 Recommended

reviewText: I liked the simpilicty of the game and that it does't need many buttons to click. I also liked how simple the plot is as well. Although for anyone who wants to play this game it requires a lot of patience and time. the only thing thats sucks is that if you do one simple mistake you have to restart.

reviewText: Fun time management game with a cute plot.  It's not super challenging but definitly not too easy either.  You do have to be careful of how/when you use your resources because if not you will get halfway through a level and realize you have to start that level over because you mismanaged.  Fun game!
